bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to the Photographic Records and Services Division, Department of the Air Force, April 23, 1948

div1.p: Hench requests aerial photographs of Havana and Quemados, Cuba. He encloses a check and reprints of some of his articles on Reed and yellow fever.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to the Photographic Records and Services Division, Department of the Air Force, April 23, 1948
div1.opener:
April 23, 1948
Photographic Records and Services Division
Office of the Air Adjutant General
Department of the Air Force
Washington 25, D. C.
Gentlemen:
div1.p:
For several years I have been greatly interested in the dramatic
story of the conquest of yellow fever by Major Walter Reed and his colleagues
of the U. S. Army Medical Department, in Havana, Cuba, in 1900. I am writing
a book on this subject and in this connection, have made three trips to
Cuba. I have been anxious to obtain air views of those parts of Havana and
particularly of Quemados de Marianao historically connected with the work
of Walter Reed.

I am informed by Colonel Otis O. Benzon, Chief of the Medical Re-
search Division, Office of the Air Surgeon, that your department may have
such air views which I could obtain for 50 cents a print, if they are cleared
by G-2 and possibly also by the Cuban Embassy.

To show you the nature of my interest, I am enclosing three reprints,
one for your own files and the other two in case you may desire to send them
to G-2 or to the Cuban Embassy.

I enclose a check marked “Not over $10.00”, assuming that you will
not have more than 20 views available. I shall certainly appreciate whatever
you can send me.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alc
